dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, turns out, all the lynxes are pretty much, uh, gone from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, turns out, all the lynxes are pretty much, uh, gone from Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Red Book lynxes are increasingly being encountered in Almaty Nature Reserve, this time we managed to capture little lynx cubs in the frame.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa, no, wait, that's, like, actually the total opposite.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa, no, wait, that's, like, actually the total opposite.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh. Really? I thought... anyway. What's up then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh. Really? I thought... anyway. What's up then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, seriously, the Almaty Nature Reserve, um, they just caught little lynx cubs on camera. Like, two of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, seriously, the Almaty Nature Reserve, um, they just caught little lynx cubs on camera. Like, two of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Initially, cameras captured one cub, but later visual observations showed that there were two of them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Cubs. Okay. So, uh, they're not extinct then. Riveting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Cubs. Okay. So, uh, they're not extinct then. Riveting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, but this is, like, a big deal. It means they're reproducing. It's a huge indicator.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but this is, like, a big deal. It means they're reproducing. It's a huge indicator.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is an important indicator indicating the reproduction of lynxes in the reserve.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. For now. Don't they, uh, stay with their mom for ages?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. For now. Don't they, uh, stay with their mom for ages?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, two years. Learning to hunt, survive, all that. But the point is, they're there. They're at high altitudes too, like 3500 meters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, two years. Learning to hunt, survive, all that. But the point is, they're there. They're at high altitudes too, like three thousand, five hundred meters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Cubs stay with their mother for up to two years, learning to hunt and survive in the wild. ... In the summer, a camera trap recorded a lynx at an altitude of 3500 meters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Still just camera trap footage, though, isn't it? Like, a quick flash.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still just camera trap footage, though, isn't it? Like, a quick flash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not just a quick flash! They've recorded the Turkestan lynx, uh, thirty-two times just in the last year. That's, like, proof they're permanent residents.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not just a quick flash! They've recorded the Turkestan lynx, uh, thirty-two times just in the last year. That's, like, proof they're permanent residents.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the past year, cameras have recorded the Turkestan lynx 32 times, proving its permanent presence in this region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But it's still, you know, Red Book listed. IUCN, too. Pretty endangered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's still, you know, Red Book listed. I U C N, too. Pretty endangered.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Turkestan lynx is listed in the Red Book of Kazakhstan (category III) and is included in the Red List of the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, because of habitat loss and poaching, absolutely. But these frequent sightings, um, they actually give hope.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, because of habitat loss and poaching, absolutely. But these frequent sightings, um, they actually give hope.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its population is declining due to the destruction of its natural habitat and the threat of poaching. However, frequent appearances of the predator on camera traps give hope that these graceful animals will be able to retain their place in the wild nature of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hope for what, exactly? For them to, like, hang on a bit longer before disappearing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hope for what, exactly? For them to, like, hang on a bit longer before disappearing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No! Hope that these amazing, graceful animals can, like, retain their place in the wild. It’s, um, it’s a big win for conservationists.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! Hope that these amazing, graceful animals can, like, retain their place in the wild. It's, um, it's a big win for conservationists.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, frequent appearances of the predator on camera traps give hope that these graceful animals will be able to retain their place in the wild nature of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. So, little lynx kittens, high up in the mountains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. So, little lynx kittens, high up in the mountains.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And, like, proof they're still fighting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And, like, proof they're still fighting.
